description:
We are looking for a Python Developer who loves automation. 
        Skills required: Python, Asyncio, Supabase, and a passion for building agentic tools. 
        Seniority: Mid-Level.
tailored_cv:
# Renan Lavirotte
[REDACTED_EMAIL] • [REDACTED_PHONE] • [REDACTED_URL] • linkedin.com/in/renan-lavirotte-695b39335/

## PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
Highly motivated and experienced multidisciplinary machine learning specialist with a strong foundation in AI-driven systems, data analysis, and predictive modeling. Proven track record of developing intelligent, real-time solutions across robotics and software projects, alongside leading high-performance teams in demanding environments.

## SKILLS
- Programming: Python, Linux, Javascript, SQL, C, sklearn, pandas, OpenCV, jupyter.
- ML algorithms: regression, supervised / unsupervised learning, decision tree algorithm.
- Languages: Fluent in English, French, and Business level in Japanese.

## EXPERIENCE

### Durham University | MEng Computer Science | 2024 – 2028
- Developed a zero-shot multimodal paradigm using InfoNCE contrastive learning and CLIP semantic alignment, achieving 34.7% accuracy on five unseen classes for cross-subject generalization.
- Conducted ablation and error analyses revealing interference between EEG and image modalities, motivating attention-based fusion for BCI applications with potential for assistive communication devices.

### Collaborative AI Bot in VR Environment (IBM Client) | Sept 2025 – Present
- Led the research and engineering of an AI bot in coordination with a 5-member team (design, mechanics, AI) for a VR application, optimizing user experience and real-time adaptive interaction for maximum engagement.
- Integrated 4 IBM SkillsBuild AI modules delivering personalized feedback to support structured progression, improving user engagement, motivation, and overall satisfaction.

### Predictive Maintenance in Distributed Systems | Nov 2025 – Dec 2025
- Extended memory safety across 3 levels (canaries, 40-byte alignment, and coalescing), ensuring fault-tolerant reliability of robotic systems in unpredictable space environments through rigorous test-driven development.
- Developed an automatic post-radiation-storm recovery mechanism detecting 100% of bit-flip corruptions, applied analytical abilities to manage end-to-end system robustness for enterprise-scale reliability.

### VR Application for IBM: Customer-Facing Support | Sept 2025 – Ongoing
- Led the research and engineering of an AI bot in coordination with a 5-member team (design, mechanics, AI) for a VR application, scoped test activities with real-time interactions for maximum engagement with end-users.
- Implemented IBM Granite AI API to deliver real-time adaptive feedback as well as 4 IBM SkillsBuild AI modules, testing behaviour and documenting best practices with enterprise for customer guidance.

### High Precision Pinch Detection in 3D Space: Computer Vision | Nov 2025 – Dec 2025
- Established unique calibration methodology achieving 90% accuracy in synchronous gesture recognition using OpenCV, MediaPipe for image processing, tested across diverse conditions for 3D spatial hand perception.
- Integrated a computer vision perception pipeline, achieving advanced finger counting, pinch detection, and pattern analysis in real-world interactive system for unstructured data handling.

## EDUCATION
### University of Durham: MEng in Computer Science | UK | 2024 – 2028
- Key modules: AI/ML, Software Engineering, Programming Paradigms, Theory of Computation.
- First-class honours (79% average) in level 1.
